subject: Software Quality Assurance and Testing - Lecture 10
topic: Microservices Testing, Mocks/Stubs, WireMock, and CI/CD

questions.question: What is a Microservices Architecture?
options: An application built as a collection of independent services
questions.correct_answer: An application built as a collection of independent services

questions.question: How do microservices typically communicate with each other?
questions.correct_answer: Using Application Programming Interfaces (APIs)

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a type of Microservices Testing in the lecture? [cite: 6]
questions.correct_answer: Beta Testing

questions.question: What is the primary goal of Unit Testing?
options: To validate the performance of each component (or unit) of the software
To test the entire application workflow
questions.correct_answer: To validate the performance of each component (or unit) of the software

questions.question: Ideally, who should perform Unit Testing and when?
questions.correct_answer: Developers during the development phase

questions.question: What does Contract Testing define?
options: The legal agreement between client and vendor
The results or outputs expected for specific inputs to ensure services can communicate
questions.correct_answer: The results or outputs expected for specific inputs to ensure services can communicate

questions.question: In Contract Testing, how should service dependencies operate?
options: They should be fully functional services
They must operate as stubs that enable a service to function without interacting with other services
questions.correct_answer: They must operate as stubs that enable a service to function without interacting with other services

questions.question: What is the goal of Integration Testing in microservices?
options: To test a single unit in isolation
To verify that microservices collaborate to achieve a joint operation as a subsystem
To verify the contract between consumer and provider
questions.correct_answer: To verify that microservices collaborate to achieve a joint operation as a subsystem

questions.question: What does End-to-End (E2E) Testing verify?
options: That the code is written in Java
That the entire application works to achieve its business objectives
That the database schema is correct
questions.correct_answer: That the entire application works to achieve its business objectives

questions.question: Why is End-to-End testing especially important for microservices architecture? [cite: 10]
options: It is faster than unit testing
It helps ensure there are no gaps between microservices and all work towards achieving their goal
questions.correct_answer: It helps ensure there are no gaps between microservices and all work towards achieving their goal

questions.question: Which strategy suggests testing high-risk microservices extensively at the beginning of the cycle?
questions.correct_answer: Pick the High-Risk Services

questions.question: What is 'Service Virtualization' used for?
options: To mock out a service to avoid delays caused by pending dependencies
To visualize the service in a diagram
To deploy services to the cloud
questions.correct_answer: To mock out a service to avoid delays caused by pending dependencies

questions.question: What is an SLA in the context of testing strategies?
questions.correct_answer: Service Level Agreement

questions.question: What are Mocks?
options: Objects that store method calls and verify interaction between Java classes
questions.correct_answer: Objects that store method calls and verify interaction between Java classes

questions.question: What type of verification are Mocks generally used for?
questions.correct_answer: Behavior verification

questions.question: Which of the following is a mocking framework mentioned in the lecture?
questions.correct_answer: Mockito

questions.question: What are Stubs?
options: Objects that hold predefined data and use it to give responses during tests
The real objects used in the application
questions.correct_answer: Objects that hold predefined data and use it to give responses during tests

questions.question: What type of verification are Stubs mainly used for?
questions.correct_answer: State verification

questions.question: What is the key characteristic of a Stub's output?
options: It always returns the predefined output regardless of the input
It depends on the system clock
questions.correct_answer: It always returns the predefined output regardless of the input

questions.question: What are Spies?
options: Partially mock objects that wrap the real object
questions.correct_answer: Partially mock objects that wrap the real object

questions.question: When are Spies useful? [cite: 17]
options: When we have a huge class and want to mock only certain methods
When we want to test the database
When we want to test the UI
questions.correct_answer: When we have a huge class and want to mock only certain methods

questions.question: What is WireMock?
options: An HTTP mock server for stubbing and verification
questions.correct_answer: An HTTP mock server for stubbing and verification

questions.question: Which of the following is a feature of WireMock?
options: Record/playback of interactions with other APIs
questions.correct_answer: Record/playback of interactions with other APIs

questions.question: How can WireMock be used?
options: As a library by any JVM application or as a standalone process
questions.correct_answer: As a library by any JVM application or as a standalone process

questions.question: WireMock's features are accessible via which interfaces?
questions.correct_answer: REST (JSON) interface and Java API

questions.question: What capability does WireMock provide regarding faults?
options: It allows injection of faults and delays
questions.correct_answer: It allows injection of faults and delays

questions.question: What is Jenkins?
options: An open-source automation tool written in Java for Continuous Integration
questions.correct_answer: An open-source automation tool written in Java for Continuous Integration

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Jenkins?
options: To build and test software projects continuously
questions.correct_answer: To build and test software projects continuously

questions.question: How does Jenkins accelerate the software development process? [cite: 27]
options: Through automation of build, test, and deploy processes
By reducing the number of tests
questions.correct_answer: Through automation of build, test, and deploy processes

questions.question: What is the default scope for the WireMock dependency in Maven?
questions.correct_answer: test

questions.question: What does a Spy do if a method is NOT stubbed?
options: It calls the real method behavior
questions.correct_answer: It calls the real method behavior

questions.question: Which object resembles a real object with the minimum number of methods needed for a test?
questions.correct_answer: Stub

questions.question: What is the term for checking the correct methods and paths applied to objects in Mocking?
questions.correct_answer: Behavior verification

questions.question: Which Mockito method is used to create a spy object?
questions.correct_answer: spy()

questions.question: In the context of CI/CD, what allows Jenkins to integrate with many technologies?
questions.correct_answer: Its plugins
